Knuckles was annoyed. Rouge had come in and stolen some of the chaos emeralds while he had been distracted. Now the only thing left was the master emerald. He'd failed.... or had he?

Knuckles could always just run in and attack with brute force, but he didn't think it would work. Rouge would just run away again. So that left stealth... but he didn't think he could do it as he was. So he sent a silent prayer to the emeralds, asking them to help him....

The emeralds began to glow a little, and Knuckles blacked out.

A long time seemed to pass, and he finally woke up. And jolted in surprise. Everything had become HUGE. Or was it that he was simply smaller. Probably about half an inch tall. His prayers must have been answered!.... Sort of. Now he could get into Rouge's hideout unnoticed, and get to the emeralds.

Of course that left two problems.... how to get into the hideout, and how would he get the emeralds out at his size. He assumed the latter would simply zap him back to normal once he got them. But as for getting in.... He glanced around. There were three entrances he could use.

A pipe that ran out from a window was low enough for Knuckles to grab. Again, one thing Knuckles didn't know was that it would take him to the hideout's bathroom.

12123.content:
Sonic twitched slightly to a series of pokes. He started roll over, only to hear a frightened shriek. His eyes immediately shot open. He sat up to see Tails looking extremely startled. "Huh? Hey, what's up, lil' buddy?" Sonicgreeted his little brother, not noticing the increased difference in size.

Tails grinned timidly. "Ummm, mostly you." Tails replied sheepishly, rubbing the back of his neck.

"Whadaya mean?" Sonic asked.

"Uhhh...you haven't noticed? I mean, well,you're way bigger than me. Seriously, you haven't noticed?" Tails asked.

"Huh?" Sonic asked. Tails pointed somewhere else and Sonic looked in that direction. Tails ran up closer to Sonic. "Uhhh, what exactly am I looking at?" Sonic asked again, turning back to look at Tails. "Wait...where'd you just go? I-"

"I'm standing right next to you." Tails said calmly.

Sonic looked around. "Well, I don't see you."

"Look down."

Sonic looked down and noticed Tails standing next to him. "What in the world!!!!?" Sonic cried in alarm.

"Exactly. Now we need to come up with a plan."
12123.title: Waking Up Under Odd Circumstances

121231.content:
"Maybe we oughta head home." Sonic shrugged.

"You should probably dust yourself off first." Tails suggested.

Sonic jumped to his feet and dusted himself off. Then, he smiled and swiped Tails up off the ground. "Ready, little lil' buddy?" he asked.

"Uhh, sure, I guess..." Tails mumbled, not even really sure what Sonic meant. Before he could even ask about it, he was moved close to Sonic's chest and in a flash Sonic shot off. "AAAAAAHHHHHH!!!!!!!" Tails screamed in panic.

Sonic's ears picked up Tails's screaming and Sonic immediately dug his heels into the ground and skidded to a stop. He swiftly raised Tails to eye level. "Tails, you okay!!?" Sonic asked in alarm.

Tails looked incredibly embarrassed. "I-I'm fine, Sonic. Just wasn't ready for that." Tails mumbled.

"Well I asked if you were ready." Sonic said pointedly.

"But I didn't realize how much faster it would be now that you're this big."

"Huh?" Sonic looked down, then sighed. "Good point. Well, needless to say, this is just one, huge work in progress." Sonic muttered. "Soooo............looks like I'm gonna hafta walk." Sonic then set Tails on his shoulder. "Well, we could always talk on the way."

"So, what do you wanna talk about?" Tails asked.

"How about what happened before I blacked out?"

"Okay. So what about it?"

"Well, there's one question. How'd you find and recognize me?" Sonic asked.

"Well, ummm...ever since that last time when you got sent hurtling back down from outer space, I decided I'd put a tracker on you. It sends a signal to let me know where you are and how serious a problem is judging by your brain waves. It sent me a distress signal so I came to check on you and found you like this unconscious. I decided to try and wake you up."

"Well thanks for that, lil' bro."
121231.title: Physical Difficulties

1212311.content:
Sonic sighed, now realizing that he had more problems to deal with. He set Tails down and plopped down. "Well this sucks!" Sonic said unhappily, folding his arms and beginning to pout.

Tails sighed, noticing the one factor he had avoided bringing up was now staring him /and/ is brother right in the face. "Sonic, it's gonna be okay. Don't worry."

"How is /THIS/ okay!?!?!? If it rains, I'm stuck!! This is /NEVER/ going to get better!!!!!" Sonic spat.

"Sonic, take it easy. I'll get to work on it. Just calm down." Tails said timidly, beginning to tremble.

"WHY DO I NEED TO CALM DOWN?!!!!!!!!!! WHAT IS THERE TO BE CALM ABOUT ANYWAY?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! THIS IS NOT IMPROVING!!!!!!!!!!!" Sonic thundered, looking extremely furious.

"AH!!!!!!" Tails shrieked as Sonic slammed a fist down right next to him.

Sonic immediately looked at Tails, only to find that Tails was shaking like a leaf. "Tails, I-" Sonic began, but Tails fled to the house, thus leaving him all alone. "Tails..." Sonic whimpered, hanging his head with his ears drooping. He sniffled softly, then got up and trudged off, not feeling anywhere near as happy as he wished he felt.

Tails peeked out at Sonic, only to find that Sonic was long gone. "Sonic?" Tails asked timidly, silently hoping that Sonic was okay. Sonic didn't respond. "Sonic?" Tails asked a little louder. Still no reply. Tails came outside and flew up, a sinking feeling inside his stomach. Sonic was nowhere in sight. Tails clenched his teeth and nervously ran a hand through his bangs. "Oh no." he whimpered. 'I gotta find him before he gets himself in any trouble."
1212311.title: More Issues

choices: Stay there for fear of causing more trouble
12123111.content:
Sonic sat down now that he was a long ways away from Tails. He pulled his knees close and rested his chin in his arms. "Poor guy. I didn't even think about how much I was upsetting him. I didn't mean to scare him so bad. I gotta get a grip. I can't let it happen again. I can count on Tails. He won't let me down. I gotta believe in him. …but what if I never get back to normal? What if I can't adjust to being this big? What if I accidentally hurt somebody? …what if I can't eat chilidogs cuz they're too small?" Sonic thought, becoming more and more worried which each thought. "What if I scared Tails too much? What if he's too afraid to come near me ever again?"

Sonic heard a sudden, female scream and looked around. He noticed a woman standing nearby. He stood up and looked around, then, much to his dismay, noticed a crush cart. The woman tried to run as he reach out for her, but he was far too agile for her. "LET GO OF ME, MONSTER!!!!!!!!!!!!" the woman screamed.

"Please, don't be scared. I won't hurt you."

"AS IF YOU HAVEN'T DONE ENOUGH DAMAGE!!!!!!!!!!!!"

Sonic's ears drooped, he put the woman down, and he sniffled. "I didn't even see it.
I'm sorry." he whimpered, trying to hold back the tears in his eyes. "Maybe I am doomed.
I already caused someone else a problem. I can't even feel anything when I sit on things." he thought.

The woman paused, noticing that the giant she had just yelled at appeared to be in a lot of pain. "Are you alright?"

"I scared my best friend earlier. I only recently got this big. I can hardly do anything without something going wrong." Sonic said weakly, sniffling.

"Oh…I'm sorry. I didn't know. I didn't mean to upset you."

"I was actually over here to try to think it out. But the more I think about it, the worse I feel. There's just so much I can't be sure of… And I'm still really sorry about your cart."

The woman smiled. "The cart was empty, by the way. If you'll help me get back to town, I can get another one."
12123111.title: Concerns and Fears

121231111.content:
Sonic sighed. "Alright. I owe you that much. But I can get too close. I don't wanna risk hurting anybody." Sonic agreed, picking the woman back up. "Just tell me where to go."

An hour or more passed as Sonic walked, attentively following each word she said until finally reaching the town. Sonic knelt and put her down. The woman paused. "Could you come with me?"

"Wh-why?!"

"I…I don't have the money for a new cart. So maybe you could help me get one."

Sonic stood up straight and folded his arms. "I owe her a new cart, but I thought she had the money for one. I…I don't think this is right, but I broke her cart. And leaving her in a situation like this would be wrong too. But which one is more right?" he thought. Then he sighed. "Alright, I'll come." Sonic conceded.

She led him around the city and then into it. Sonic had major difficulty not stepping on anything or anyone, but almost everyone had run away screaming at the sight of him. Finally, the woman went inside a building, so Sonic, very carefully, sat down. A few minutes later, the woman returned with a tall, and quite bulky, man. "See? That's why I need a new cart."

"You managed to lure a giant into the city to support your story. Well listen close girl, the world spins on money. I'm not just gonna give you a cart because you dragged a giant into it."

"Ahem!" Sonic announced. The man turned to look. "Uhh…hi…ummm…how about you just give her the dang cart?"

"I will, once she pays for it."

"But she doesn't have the money for one and I wrecked her last one with my butt. Of course, I guess if you don't give her one I could get her one myself." Sonic said pointedly.

"Alright, go take your business someplace else."

"Heh. Sorry, but that's not what I meant when I said I'd get her one myself if I have to." Sonic snickered. The man glared up at Sonic, who reached out and removed the roof of the building. "So, you gonna give her one or will I have to take it by force?"

"You don't seem like the type to steal."

"I'm also not the type to let debts go unpaid. And I owe her a cart. So this is a debt I'm about to pay off."

"Don't you dare!"

"Try and stop me." The man jumped up and tried to contact police, only for a part of the roof to fall on his head and knock him out. Sonic grabbed a cart with utmost caution and picked it up. He set it down in front of the woman. "Here."

"Thank you. Perhaps we'll meet again. What's your name?"

"Sonic the Hedgehog. Now I gotta go before I cause any more destruction." Sonic said as he walked off.
121231111.title: A Renewed Courage

1212311111.content:
Sonic walked slowly back to where he had been originally. Suddenly, he heard an all too familiar voice. "Sonic, are you out here?!!!! If you can here me, say something!!!!!!!" the voice shouted. He noticed Tails about to turn the corner. Sonic quickly looked around and dove behind the tallest rock he could find. "WHOA!!!!!!!!!" Tails cried, stumbling as he tried to maintain his balance. Tails looked around. "SONIC I KNOW THAT WAS YOU!!!!!!!!!!! COME ON!!!!!!!!!!! JUST COME OVER HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!" he shouted as loud as he could. Sonic tensed. Tails looked around, then noticed the two legs and butt sticking out behind a rock. He chuckled a little and came up to it. "I see you. You don't quite fit behind here."

Sonic curled up tightly, afraid to move. He didn't want to scare Tails. "Please, go home. Without me." Sonic thought as silent tears streamed down from his eyes.

"Sonic…you okay?" Tails asked worriedly, coming closer. He now heard sniffling. "Sonic………did I say something wrong?"

Sonic uncurled and backed away from Tails. "Go home." he sniffled.

Tails flew up to Sonic and hugged him. "Please don't cry."

"I'm not crying!"

"Sonic, is this about what happened earlier? Because I'm really sorry about what happened. I'm getting used to it, too, ya' know. But I don't want you to be so worked up because I panicked. So please, just come home. I'm working on something to keep you out of the rain. But I can't do it without you. So come on. Please."
1212311111.title: Unprepared

12123111111.content:
Sonic looked at Tails for a few seconds. Tails looked so worried. Sonic didn't want to see Tails like that, but he knew it was his fault too. He thought for a moment and came to the conclusion that he didn't want to be all alone. So he nodded and picked Tails up. Tails hugged Sonic before Sonic could even begin to change his mind. Sonic felt greatly relieved to know Tails still trusted him that much. He headed home with Tails holding on tight. Once home, he plopped down and set Tails down. "Sonic, promise me you won't run off like that again. It really worried me." Tails said softly.

Sonic's heart sank, knowing that he reaction to what had happened earlier had been worse than what he did that had scared Tails. "I promise. As long as you won't be scared of me. No matter what."

Tails's heart sank, remembering how he had reacted to Sonic earlier. He flew up and hugged Sonic again. "I promise." Tails replied. Sonic hugged Tails back and closed his eyes. "And I'm still sorry for running from you earlier."

"I'm still sorry for scarin' you off. So I guess that makes it even." Sonic sighed. Tails nuzzled in a little closer. "Now you go ahead and get to work. I'll be right here."

"Okay. Just let me know if you need anything."

"Well, I'm kinda hungry but that can wait." Sonic mumbled, scratching the back of his head. Tails looked a bit pensive for a moment and then nodded and went inside.

133.content:
Vanilla stared curiously at the package in her lap. It was white in color, wrapped with a silken red ribbon. A tag tied around the ribbon read "From An Admirer." She blushed, wondering who this "admirer" could be. The thought of a gentleman caller trying to woo her with gifts made her feel like a teenager again. Hands trembling, she carefully undid the ribbon and removed the lid of the box, expecting flowers, candy, perhaps even jewelry...

"A bottle?" Vanilla wondered aloud. This wasn't the gift she was expecting. It wasn't a perfume bottle, just a plain glass bottle, filled with a clear, pinkish-red liquid and sealed with a cork. Enclosed with the bottle was a handwritten note. Burning with curiosity, Vanilla picked it up and read:

Vanilla, you are a stunningly beautiful woman with a soft, gentle eyes and a smile that could warm the coldest heart. But on top of that, you are a loving mother with a heart of gold. You have always helped those in need with a smile, never asking for anything in return. I think it's time somebody did something for you. Although you're not one to complain, I know you've been wishing for a change of pace in your life lately, which is why I've sent you this gift. Just drink the contents of this bottle and I guarantee, you will experience life in a whole new way. Please don't be alarmed: it's not poisoned or drugged.

"What?!" the woman staggered back in shock and fell on the couch, landing on a pile of clean laundry. She looked at herself in fear as she watched her legs stretch further and further across the floor, and yet somehow her clothing still fit perfectly on her. "I don't understand, please stop!"

"Stop!"

The moment her daughter said the word, she felt the growth come to a screeching halt. She looked down at her daughter and gasped at how small she seemed now, knowing that in fact, she was actually just much bigger than normal. She stood up to her full height...
